intro: Guettardella megacarpa, commonly known as the giant seedpod tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, woody capsules that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. These capsules contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecology.
